definition[0]: to take part in something that a group of people are doing or that someone else does
example[0]: In the evening there was a barbecue, with the whole village joining in the fun.
example[1]: He stared at them without joining in the conversation.
example[2]: He laughed loudly, and Mattie joined in.
definition[1]: to take part in something with another group, company, or organization
example[3]: We would be eager to join in projects of that sort.
